childMarkdownRemark.html:
Whether its a side-hustle, one person operation or even a large growing site, the addition of webhooks to you workflow can save you time and ensure that your site or blog has a fresh build whenever assets are added. The webhooks can be customized to fire a build of your deployed site when a number of different actions are taken by team members or stakeholders. The publishing of assets to the site are the main reason why I chose to include them in my blog site.

The other main reason for adding webhooks is for scheduled content publishing. Being able to queue up a series of posts say, for instance, when you go on vacation, or even just a way to ensure that you readers get the experience of fresh content they have come to expect - hooks will help you in your quest for consistent content delivery.
Adding a Webhook to your CMS workflow can save you time as well as ensure consistency.

node.title: The Long road to headless CMS

childMarkdownRemark.html:
What a day it has been. In fact - what a year. Less than 12 months ago, I made a leap, from what ? Hard to say, but what I can tell you is that faith was certainly involved. For the last 5 years I have travelled tens of thousands of miles visited new lands and absorbed countless new cultural norms. However revitalising travel is for the soul, its no match for the crushing nature of self doubt.

Sometimes jumping straight into the abyss is the only way to know if you can survive such a leap. Those same 5 years that I roamed around India with my girlfiend, it struck me that my complacency had gotten the better of me. Laying dormant in a career that had not once tested my thirst for challenge but instead my rewarded my subconscious appetite for the mundane.

As thankful as I have been for the opportunity to travel and work simultaneously (as many have not), it was time to make a substantial change. Since my high school days I have often considered myself a technology enthusiast, sometimes having been paid real money to solve technical issues for those in need. The aspect of my work that was really missing was a creative outlet - an undiscovered pasture on which to graze, vanquish, starve - only to live another day in search of the same. A meaningful existance.

My experience in the Ontario educational system had taught me many things, but just as often disuaded me from paths I was deemed unfit to pursue. I waas aeasy target
A day in the life of a new developer trying to create portfolio grade work while testing out new technologies.
Look how far i've come. Just when you thought two was enough, there were three. Let's see what else I can do now that i have a CMS system and a responsive front end in hand...More to come.
